result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Lynn Barry

records.addlTxt: L.U. advised she sent order to DHHS. MG

9:50 AM Defendant Amber Lynn Barry appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Amber Lynn Barry.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Lloyd states that the defendant has a Chapter 55 protective placement in a different county and is unsure if the court will need to order a competency evaluation as well.  Atty Juech responds.
Court finds probable cause for the charges.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders a Competency Evaluation


Atty Juech objects to the modification of the cash bond.  Court questions Atty Lloyd as to where the defendant would be living if released from jail.  Atty Lloyd has not received an answer from the guardian yet.
BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will remain; motion denied
Preliminary Hearing for this afternoon will be taken off the calendar
Competency hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on November 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
NOHR also scanned down to Jail

10:13 AM Defendant Amber Lynn Barry appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Amber Lynn Barry.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Lloyd states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Lloyd does not waive the time limits and asks that it be set.

BY THE COURT: Time limits not waived; set Prelim.
If it is a waiver, it can be held by zoom.
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*No contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2  *No contact with or going on the premises of the Mill Pond Apartments  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

3:19 PM Defendant Amber Lynn Barry appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify for PD appointment; requests an IA be set. Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.

3:51pm  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Burdon states that the defendant has failed to appear for her court appearances from a different County.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2 
*No contact with or going on the premises of the Mill Pond Apartments
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
